yaml.title: EVCI siting model

markdown.markdown:
<!-- WARNING: THIS FILE WAS AUTOGENERATED! DO NOT EDIT! -->

`Arguments`:

1. `charging_type`: a string indicating opportunity or destination charging.
2. `r`: a dictionary of global parameters read from the xlsx files.
3. `s_df_distances`: a dataframe of Euclidean distances of each site from all others. (NxN matrix)
4. `j`: string indicating specific charger type
5. `i`: integer indicating a specific site
6. `hj`: 
7. `k`: integer year (1, 2 or 3 of the policy)
8. `backoff`: a boolean indicating whether backoff should be incorporated
9. `backoff_factor`: a float weighting factor for the backoff (mostly empirically selected)

`Returns`:

1. `norm_uw`: float indicating normalized utilization on a typical working day
2. `norm_uh`: float indicating normalized utilization on a typical holiday
3. `norm_vw`: float indicating number of vehicles not utilizing charging on a working day
4. `norm_vh`: float indicating number of vehicles not utilizing charging on a holiday

`Arguments`:

1. `r`: a dictionary of global parameters read from the xlsx files.
2. `i`: integer indicating a specific site

`Returns`:

integer. Capex value for a given site

`Arguments`:

1. `charging_type`: a string indicating opportunity or destination charging.
2. `r`: a dictionary of global parameters read from the xlsx files.
3. `s_df`: a dataframe of the sites
4. `s_df_distances`: a dataframe of Euclidean distances of each site from all others. (NxN matrix)
5. `i`: integer indicating a specific site

`Returns`:

integer opex value for a given site

`Arguments`:

1. `charging_type`: a string indicating opportunity or destination charging.
2. `r`: a dictionary of global parameters read from the xlsx files.
3. `s_df`: a dataframe of sites
4. `s_df_distances`: a dataframe of Euclidean distances of each site from all others. (NxN matrix)
5. `i`: integer indicating a specific site

`Returns`:

integer margin value of a site

`Arguments`:

1. `charging_type`: a string indicating whether opportunity or destination charging
1. `r`: a dictionary of global variables read from Excel files
3. `s_df`: pre-processed geopandas dataframe with each point stored as shapely point object
4. `backoff_factor`: a float value of backoff to cater for neighborhood (empirical)
5. `sid`: session id
6. `aid`: id
7. `cluster`: a boolean indicating if clustering is performed
8. `stage`: string indicating whether `initial` or `clustered` stage

`Returns`:

A dataframe of utilization values for all sites.

2. `r`: a dictionary of global parameters read from the xlsx files.

`Arguments`:

1. `charging_type`: a string indicating whether opportunity or destination charging
1. `r`: a dictionary of global variables read from Excel files
3. `s_df`: pre-processed geopandas dataframe with each point stored as shapely point object
